citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), Office for Coastal Management (OCM)
citeinfo.title: ENOW2015_OceanEconomyPercentByState

descript.abstract: This dataset summarizes 2015 employment and gross domestic product (GDP) Ocean Economy statistics including (a) the Ocean Economy employment and GDP for each state as a percentage of the total state Coastal Economy and (b) the total Ocean Economy for all coastal states as a percentage of the national Coastal Economy. This information was harvested from the Economics: National Ocean Watch (ENOW) time-series data on the ocean and Great Lakes economy, derived from the Bureau of Labor Statistics and the Bureau of Economic Analysis. The Ocean Economy consists of six economic sectors dependent on the oceans and Great Lakes, including: Marine Construction, Living Resources, Offshore Mineral Extraction, Ship and Boat Building, Tourism and Recreation, and Marine Transportation.
descript.purpose: To support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Energy Policy Act, Coastal Zone Management Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.
descript.supplinf: Individual state statistics are reported for U.S. coastal states and regional Coastal US statistics are aggregated from all U.S. coastal states adjacent to the oceans or the Great Lakes.

idinfo.useconst: These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation. http://www.marinecadastre.gov/about/disclaimer.html
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.4.1.5713

attracc.attraccr: The attributes in this dataset are believed to be accurate.

dataqual.logic: These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.
dataqual.complete: Spatial and attribute properties are believed to be complete, although attribute information has been simplified. Geometric thresholds from original data are preserved. No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness.

horizpa.horizpar: Maximum scale of intended use is 1:80,000.

citeinfo.origin: NOAA Office for Coastal Management, Economics: National Ocean Watch (ENOW)
citeinfo.title: Economics: National Ocean Watch (ENOW) Data (2015)
citeinfo.othercit: The Economics: National Ocean Watch (ENOW) data set features time-series data focused on the six economic sectors that are dependent on the oceans and Great Lakes, and is based on data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics and the Bureau of Economic Analysis. ENOW is available for counties, states, regions, and the nation in a wide variety of formats. More information on the ENOW dataset, including limitations, can be found at: https://coast.noaa.gov/digitalcoast/data/enow.html

srcinfo.srccontr: Provides statistical summaries on the six economic sectors and four economic indicators dependent on the oceans and Great Lakes for coastal U.S. states.

procstep.procdesc: Download the tabular data containing: (A) STATE_STATISTICS - state statistics for the four economic indicators for each ocean sector, (B) SECTOR_PCT - percentages of state employment and GDP for each ocean sector out of the total state Ocean Economy employment/GDP, and (C) STATE_PCT - state Ocean Economy employment and GDP shown as a percent of the total state Coastal Economy and national Coastal Economy.
Import the STATE_PCT table into a file geodatabase, then append records into final table with schema enforced.

enttyp.enttypd: State Ocean Economy Employment and GDP shown as a percent of the total state coastal economy and national coastal economy numbers for 2015.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
